F. H. LaGUARDIA, Mayor
M. S. NOVIK, Director
CITY OF NEW YORK

WORTH 2-5600
WNYC
And
Stations
WASJ
WKDX
WEHA
W2XVP
WNYK
WNYL
WNYN
WNYO
June 6, 1941
Mr. Frank E. Schooley, Exec. Sec.
The Natl.Assn.of Educational Broadcasters
University of Illinois
Urbana, Illinois
My dear Frank:
Regarding your June 3rd Executive
Committee request, anything that would promote
education "by radio is all right with me, and if
it takes a new organization to do it, I'm for
that also. I'll vote, "yes", and if you want
me to vote ''yes" twice, that's O.K. with me.
MSN:sd
P. S. —On the matter of the convention, did I tell you
at Columbus that I was thoroughly convinced by Carl
Menzer and ready to go to St. Louis? Eeaven help
us if we hit a hot spell that weekend.
NEW YORK
WORLD’S FAIR 1940
M.S.N.
New York City's Own Station”—810 Kc.
